Job Posting:173068 - Position: W26 Student Data Engineer, Finance Transformation 173068 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/18/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 09/10/2025 05:56 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country OMERS 200 Bay Street Suite 1410, South Tower Toronto M5J 2J2 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Student Data Engineer, Finance Transformation 173068 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Job Title: Student Data Engineer, Finance Transformation (Winter 2026, 4 Months) Job ID: JR-7502 Choose a workplace that empowers your impact. Join a global workplace where employees thrive. One that embraces diversity of thought, expertise and passion. A place where you can personalize your employee journey to be - and deliver - your best. We are a leading global real estate investor, developer and manager. We combine our capital with our capabilities to create real estate that strengthens economies and communities. By prioritizing people, partnerships and places, we generate meaningful returns for OMERS members, enhance value for our capital partners and create a brighter world for our customers. Join us to accelerate your growth & development, prioritize wellness, build connections, and support the communities where we live and work. Don't just work anywhere - come build tomorrow together with us. Know someone at OMERS or Oxford Properties? Great! If you're referred, have them submit your name through Workday first. Then, watch for a unique link in your email to apply. The student analyst will be a key member of the Oxford Finance Transformation team and will play an integral role on our ongoing process, people, and technology improvement initiatives across the Global Finance & Technology team. Responsibilities: • Participate in the delivery of projects by working closely with finance and technology professionals and external vendors. • Build data pipelines in the data platform and assist maintaining the data warehouse. • Adhere to the testing procedures, create test cases and perform System and User Acceptance Testing (UAT). • Assist in the preparation of data analysis, process documentation, and reporting. • Support project management activities as required (project progress, status, and issues/risk tracking). • Prepare and provide analytical insights on improvement opportunities within our project portfolio. • Support our finance learning & development content creation, delivery and administration. • Participate in ad hoc initiatives and special projects as required. Support Data Governance initiatives across the organization, standing up market best practices for framework in multiple areas. • What's in it for you • A team that is ready to focus on your growth and development • Opportunity to work in a dynamic, collaborative and high-performing team • Networking opportunities through interactions with different areas of our finance & technology teams Opportunity to be a part of the student community at Oxford & OMERS • Oxford's purpose is to strengthen economies and communities through real estate. Our people-first culture is at its best when our workforce reflects the communities where we live and work - and the customers we proudly serve. From hire to retire, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process that extends all the way through your employee experience. This sense of belonging and connection is cultivated up, down and across our global organization thanks to our vast network of Employee Resource Groups with executive leader sponsorship, our Purpose@Work committee and employee recognition programs. Job Requirements Qualifications: • Currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering. • Strong skills in writing and understanding SQL queries, Python; ETL and data warehousing concepts are assets. • Strong communication skills (written and verbal) and excellent interpersonal skills • Ability to work in a collaborative team environment • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail • Proven ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and tight deadlines • Knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) • Self-starter able to work independently with minimal supervision • Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint (required); Visio is an asset • Knowledge on BI Tools tools is an asset Prior real estate experience and/or previous experience in a project-based environment is considered an asset • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://careers.omers.com/ca/en/job/JR-7502/Student-Data-Engineer-Finance-Transformation-Winter-2026-4-Months Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
